articles.title: Talks between Kim Yong Nam and Ugandan President Held
articles.content:
Talks between Kim Yong Nam and Ugandan President Held
						
 Kampala, October 30 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Talks between Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to Uganda and Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of the Republic of Uganda, were held at the presidential palace on Thursday.
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and other issues of mutual concern.
					
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, Myong Kyong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Uganda, and other suite members and from the Ugandan side were Asuman Kiyingi, acting foreign minister, and officials concerned of the Foreign Ministry.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Speaker of National Assembly of Uganda
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Speaker of National Assembly of Uganda
						
 Kampala, October 30 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to Uganda, met and had a friendly talk with the speaker of the National Assembly of Uganda at its building on Oct. 30.
					 Present there were Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, Myong Kyong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Uganda, and other suite members and Asuman           Kiyingi, acting foreign minister of Uganda, and the chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee of the National Assembly of Uganda, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Ugandan President Gives Banquet for Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Ugandan President Gives Banquet for Kim Yong Nam
 Kampala, October 30 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of the Republic of Uganda, gave a banquet at the presidential palace on Thursday in honor of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to Uganda.
					 Present there on invitation were Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, Myong Kyong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Uganda, and other suite members.
					
					 Present there were Edward Kiwanuka Ssekandi, vice-president of Uganda, Dorothy Hyuha, deputy secretary general of the Uganda National Resistance Movement, Kahinda Otafire, minister of Justice, Jacob Oranya, vice-speaker of the National Assembly, Asuman Kiyingi, acting foreign minister, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries in the country.
					
					 Yoweri Kaguta Museveni in a speech said that the DPRK rendered material and moral assistance to Uganda and other African countries in their struggle to build a new society after their independence.
					
					 He expressed the will to make every possible effort to boost cooperation with the DPRK in the Non-aligned Movement and international arena.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam, speaking next, said that the firm foundation for the development of the bilateral relations provided by President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and HE Yoweri Kaguta Museveni is growing stronger thanks to the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He expressed the belief that his visit would make a positive contribution to further developing the traditional relations of friendship between the DPRK and Uganda.

articles.title: Congratulations to President of Brazil
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Brazil
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Dilma Vana Rousseff upon her reelection as president of Brazil on Oct. 28.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger and sincerely wished her greater success in her responsible work.

articles.title: Condolences to Zambian Vice-President
articles.content:
Condolences to Zambian Vice-President
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Thursday sent a message to Guy Scott, vice-president of the Republic of Zambia, expressing condolences over the death of  its President Michael Chilufya Sata of illness.
					 The message expressed deep condolences to the vice-president and, through him, to the Zambian government, people and bereaved family of the president.
					
					 It hoped that the friendly Zambian government and people would overcome the sorrow and achieve the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to New Indonesian FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to New Indonesian FM
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong on Oct. 30 sent congratulations to Retno Lestari Priansari Marsudi upon her appointment as foreign minister of Indonesia.
					 In the belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished her success in her future work.

articles.title: Greetings to Algerian National Liberation Front Party
articles.content:
Greetings to Algerian National Liberation Front Party
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on Oct. 31 sent a congratulatory message to the Central Committee of the Algerian National Liberation Front Party on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of its foundation.
					 Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative ties between the two parties would grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished the Algerian National Liberation Front Party greater success in its activities for strengthening it and achieving the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Spokesman for NPCK Condemns S. Korean Authorities for Extending Transfer of OPECON
articles.content:
Spokesman for NPCK Condemns S. Korean Authorities for Extending Transfer of OPECON
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea (NPCK) Thursday issued a statement assailing the south Korean puppet authorities for extending the transfer of OPECON (wartime operation control) in collusion and conspiracy with the U.S.
					 The statement branded the puppet group's action as a hideous act of treachery putting the five traitors of 1905 into the shade who sold off the country to outside forces and a dangerous act of pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula and the region to the brink of a nuclear war.
					
					 There are many countries and nations on the earth but it does not know such wicked sycophants and traitors as the south Korean authorities who offered a huge amount of money for refusing to take over the military sovereignty usurped by the outside forces, it noted, and continued:
					
					 South Korea which had been reduced to a colonial servant of the U.S. after being deprived of military sovereignty, the core of national sovereignty, by it cannot but be a laughing stock of the world people as it pretends to be an "advanced state," talking about "state status."
					
					 The military conspiracy and nexus for aggression between the U.S. and the puppet regime have gone beyond a tolerance limit, further increasing the danger of a nuclear war on the peninsula and putting peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world at great peril.
					
					 The prevailing situation eloquently proves how just the DPRK is when it is bolstering up its nuclear deterrent for self-defence in every way, holding aloft the banner of the line for simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never allow the U.S. and puppet warmongers' moves to ignite a nuclear war but resolutely foil them with its powerful treasured sword of Songun.
					
					 The dangerous military conspiracy and nexus between the U.S. and the puppet regime will bring them nothing but a shameful destruction.

articles.title: Outside and Inside the UN Contesting the UN Human Rights COI Report on North Korea
articles.content:
Outside and Inside the UN Contesting the UN Human Rights COI Report on North Korea
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Chinese internet newspaper the 4th Media News posted an article titled "Outside and Inside the UN Contesting the UN Human Rights COI Report on North Korea" on October 28. 
					 The full text said as follows:
					
					 A small demonstration that took place across the street from the UN on Wednesday, October 22 was a sign of the problem represented by the Commission of Inquiry (COI) report by the UN Human Rights Council on North Korea. The COI report had been issued in March 2014.
					
					 The demonstrators carried posters challenging the action by the UN. The posters portrayed the sentiment that the report and UN actions around the report represented an injustice. These posters included statement such as:
					
					 "Stop Using N Korean Human Right as a Weapon for Another Korean War", "Stop Shameful Hypocrisy Pretending Human Rights Defender", "Stop Psychological Warfare on the Korean Peninsula", "Remember S. Korean National Security Law An Extreme Human Rights Violation!!!", "Guantanamo Bay Detention Camp, Human Rights???", "Human Rights, Why Only N. Korea???", "Mind Your Business in the U.S.A.???"
					
					 The reason the issues raised by the demonstration are important is that the UN has not attempted any impartial investigation of the Korean conflict to determine its roots and how to find a resolution.
					
					 The signs carried by these demonstrators provide clues to the context in which this Commission of Inquiry operated. If the COI report is intended as a weapon to start another Korean War, as one of the signs proposed, then the actions the Human Rights Council are but a pretext for an aggressive action against a sovereign nation.
					
					 Another poster asked if the Human Rights Council considered violations of human rights such as the Guantanamo Bay Detention Camp in the US or the National Security Law in South Korea?
					
					 These are well documented examples of serious Human Rights abuses, but instead of doing something to condemn such documented abuses, the Human Rights Council is targeting North Korea where there is little actual evidence that could be recognized in a court of law of any such human rights abuses.
					
					 Instead the kinds of claims being substituted for evidence are testimony of defectors, and supposed satellite images.
					
					 In the Iraq case in 2003, such so called evidence proved inaccurate, yet provided a pretext for the US invasion and regime change activity.
					
					 This protest held outside the UN at noon was in response to an event being held at the UN later in the day. The event, sponsored by the permanent missions of Panama, Botswana, and Australia was to present the testimony of two North Koreans who had defected to South Korea and who were making a plea that member states support an upcoming resolution by the EU and Japan against North Korea.
					
					 The DPRK had not been invited to offer its position, but its representatives did attend the event. They were called on only as part of the question period at the end of the event.
					
					 During the question period, the DPRK representatives raised the criticism that the COI report did not make any effort to be an all sided report. Instead it only presented the testimony of the defectors, of critics of North Korea.
					
					 The content of the testimony presented at the Oct 22 UN meeting included often repeated claims of harsh treatment, but missing were clear statements of what the circumstances were of the situations being described. Nor was there any effort to provide factual evidence supporting the claims.
					
					 The head of the Commission of Inquiry, the Australian Judge Michael Kirby played a major role in this meeting at the UN. In response to a comment form the DPRK representatives that the soliciting of the testimony from the defector witnesses was politically motivated, Judge Kirby responded that his experience as a judge was such that he knew how to conduct such questioning.
					
					 His response failed to acknowledge that the role he is playing in the UN process is not the same as in a national court of law, where there are expected to be standards for evidence and due process for the accused.
					
					 Also in a national court of law there are in general appeals processes for the accused, as well as the right of the accused to confront those who are making the accusations.
					
					 No such rights are accorded to the accused by the process that the Judge is involved in. Instead he is acting as a prosecutor with no rights for the accused to provide a defense.
					
					 At the UN meeting, the representatives of both Panama and Botswana spoke about their interest in fulfilling the obligations of the Responsibility to Protect (R2P) framework as part of why they are supporting taking action against North Korea. The problem with such statements is that they are ignoring the abuse that occurred by NATO in Libya under the mantle of R2P.
					
					 This event at the UN on Wednesday, October 22, was directed at urging support for actions at the UN directed against North Korea. But another event a few days earlier demonstrated the need for a very different approach to the question of the stalemate in efforts to resolve the conflicts that exist between the US/EU and North Korea.
					
					 This event which took place on Monday, October 20, was sponsored by the US Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) and was chaired by Donald Gregg, a former US Ambassador to South Korea.(1)
					
					 The program featured Gregg interviewing Jang Il Hun who is the Deputy Ambassador for the DPRK Mission to the UN, with time provided for questions from those in the audience.
					
					 Ambassador Jang is the DPRK representative for the New York channel for contact between the DPRK and the US. The US has no formal diplomatic relations with the DPRK.
					
					 The tone of most of the CFR event provided a striking contrast to the UN meeting held a few days later.
					
					 Introducing the topic of the program, Ambassador Gregg referred to a program held earlier in the year with Judge Kirby discussing the COI report process. During this earlier program at CFR Ambassador Gregg asked Judge Kirby if he had noticed any improvement in the situation in North Korea.
					
					 Judge Kirby responded that he had observed improvement under Kim Jong Un. As Gregg noted, however, this judgment was not reflected in the COI report. (2)
					
					 Also the issue of the stalemate in relations between the US and the DPRK was raised. Ambassador Jang was asked what could be done to help to make a breakthrough to end the stalemate.
					
					 In general it was agreed that neither accusations regarding human rights problems nor even efforts to revive the long stalled six party talks process would be a helpful direction. Instead a visit by a friendly group organized by the Council of Foreign Relations was proposed and Ambassador Jang responded that if he received a detailed proposal for such a visit, he could make recommendations about it to his capital. (3)
					
					 These three situations demonstrate that there are substantive issues to be discussed through a diplomatic process with the DPRK. The program at the CFR in particular demonstrated that if an effort is made to resolve problems with the DPRK, progress is possible.
					
					 Meanwhile actions being taken by nations like Japan and the EU in particular who are threatening to bring a resolution against the DPRK, can only deepen the conflicts. And holding meetings inside or outside the UN where defector witnesses are encouraged to urge member nations of the UN to condemn the DPRK are but acts to fan the flames of hostility and conflict.
					
					 The demonstration in front of the UN and the CFR meeting, though held outside the UN, reveal that the obligations of the UN Charter are obligations that can be met. And that the process of conflict resolution needs the broad participation of all those who can contribute to its success.
					
					 There seem to be two tactics being used in international relations with the DPRK. Either hold punishment meeting or encourage dialogue. The UN Charter supports only the latter efforts.

articles.title: Technology for Cultivating Plant Nutritive Accelerants Developed
articles.content:
Technology for Cultivating Plant Nutritive Accelerants Developed
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Turf Institute under the State Academy of Sciences has recently developed a new technology for massively cultivating plant nutritive accelerants.
					 The technology makes it possible to artificially cultivate accelerants, not depending on roots of host plants. And it costs lower than the existing technologies, while shortening the date of cultivation.
					
					 The new technology is considered to have a bright prospect for taking good effect in agricultural production and afforestation.

articles.title: Sangwon Temple and Dagobas in Mt. Myohyang
articles.content:
Sangwon Temple and Dagobas in Mt. Myohyang
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Among the attractions in Mt. Myohyang, one of eight scenic beauties in Korea, are Sangwon Temple and dagobas.
					 Sangwon Temple is a hermitage under Pohyon Temple and located in Sangwondong Valley.
					
					 The temple is believed to be built in the period of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392). According to historic data, it was rebuilt in 1580. 
					
					 It consists of a main temple and three pavilions.
					
					 There are also dagobas in Sangwondong Valley lying west of Pohyon Temple. Dagobas are considered to be precious national heritage showing the stone-working art of the Korean nation.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime said that the scenery around Sangwon Temple tops all scenic beauties of Mt. Myohyang.
					
					 And leader Kim Jong Il personally explored the path leading to the temple and took a measure to build up the path.
					
					 Now, Sangwon Temple and its surroundings have been spruced up for a resting place of the working people of the DPRK and a tourist showplace well known over the world.
					
					 Sangwon Temple and dagobas were registered as one of national cultural heritages.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Five-Point Policy of Great National Unity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Five-Point Policy of Great National Unity 
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il published the work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" on April 18, Juche 87 (1998).
					 He in the work set it as the five-point policy of the great national unity to abide by the principle of national independence, call on all Koreans to unite under the banner of patriotism, the banner of national reunification, improve the north-south relations, struggle against foreign forces' domination and interference and anti-reunification forces and develop all Koreans' contacts and dialogue and strengthen their solidarity and alliance.
					
					 The five-point policy of the great national unity serves as an immortal great programme for independent reunification which most correctly reflects the needs of the era and the aspiration and will of all Koreans for unity and reunification, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The policy for achieving the great national unity on the principle of national independence serves as a powerful weapon for achieving the country's reunification with the nation's driving force and the independent development of a reunified country and prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 The principle of national independence is the core of solving the nation's problem and a basis of great national unity.
					
					 This principle calls for solving all issues arising in accomplishing the cause of national reunification by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 The policy for getting all Koreans united under the banner of patriotism, the banner of national reunification, is an expression of the idea of patriotism and noble intention of Kim Jong Il to achieve the country's reunification by uniting all people who value the soul of the nation irrespective of ideology and social system, political view and religious belief.
					
					 The validity and vitality of the five-point policy of the great national unity which reflects Kim Jong Il's iron-willed patriotic will for reunification were strikingly demonstrated in the reality of the June 15 era of reunification and they powerfully encourage all the Koreans in the cause of great national unity.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Assailed for Indefinitely Extending Transfer of OPECON
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Assailed for Indefinitely Extending Transfer of OPECON
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Papers here Friday in commentaries hit the south Korean authorities for indefinitely extending the transfer of the right to the wartime operation control (OPECON) at the 46th south Korea-U.S. annual security consultative meeting.
					   Rodong Sinmun brands the south Korean authorities' extension of the transfer of OPECON in conspiracy and nexus with the U.S. as an unprecedented act of treachery leaving the military sovereignty to the tender mercy of the outside forces for an indefinite period and an unpardonable criminal act to realize their scenario for invading the north, backed by their American master. 
					
					 The puppet regime cited the lack of independent capability to cope with the "north's threat" as a reason for the extension of the transfer of OPECON but this is nothing but a clumsy trick to escape criticism at home and abroad and cover up its sinister intention, the paper notes, and goes on:
					
					 Its reckless action is an inevitable product of the traitors' inveterate evil practice to stay in power and do harm to compatriots in the north and their submission to the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK will never allow the U.S. and the south Korean regime's extension of the transfer of OPECON but strongly react against it.
					
					 Minju Joson notes the army and people of the DPRK will never tolerate the above-said action for aggression but join the compatriots in south Korea and abroad in strongly countering it.

articles.title: S. Korea: Unionists Protest Pension Reform
articles.content:
S. Korea: Unionists Protest Pension Reform
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Government Employees Union in south Korea held a rally outside the "Saenuri Party" building on Oct. 28 in protest against the bill for pension reform, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The union declared it would stage a general strike, saying that the pension reform bill can never be accepted as it was unilaterally worked out by the "Saenuri Party" without having consultation with government employees.
					
					 More than 200 heads of union branches conducted a haircutting ceremony in protest against the authorities' attempt for retrogressive pension reform.

articles.title: Actions for Institution of Special Law on Ferry Sewol Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Institution of Special Law on Ferry Sewol Staged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea staged actions in Seoul, Pusan, Taegu, Kwangju, Suwon of Kyonggi Province and other parts of south Korea on Oct. 28 in demand of probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 Members of the organizations accused Chongwadae of refusing to pay heed to the voices of the bereaved families and citizens demanding the probe into the truth about the disaster.
					
					 Policemen ran riot to suppress the protestors, but they offered strong resistance against them.
					
					 The bereaved families who have struggled for the probe into the truth about the ferry disaster and the institution of a special law held a press conference outside the building of the "National Assembly" on the same day, urging the "government" to clarify its measure for finding out those missing.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Her Hypocrisy
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Her Hypocrisy 
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore in an editorial on Wednesday accused the puppet chief executive of her hypocritical behavior.
					 In a "policy speech" at the "National Assembly" (NA) that day the chief executive told the "people should pool their efforts", the editorial noted, adding that she, however, did not glance at the bereaved families of the ferry Sewol disaster when they were waiting for her before the NA building.
					
					 Such attitude makes it hard to see her willingness for pooling the people's efforts, it said.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Raps Chief Executive's Deceptive Tirade
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Raps Chief Executive's Deceptive Tirade 
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Kyunghyang Daily News of south Korea on Thursday carried an article critical of the chief executive's farce to deceive the public opinion.  
					 Park Geun Hye in her "policy speech" made at the "National Assembly" on Wednesday talked about economy, improvement of people's living and rooting out of illegal acts, the article said and went on:
					
					 She, however, said nothing about such sensitive problems pending urgent solution as the probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster, mending of the deteriorated inter-Korean relations and indefinite extension of the transfer of the right to the wartime operation control.
					
					 In the final analysis, she didn't mention at all what the people would like to hear from her.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Nigerian Organization on Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Nigerian Organization on Website
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on Oct. 26.
					 The work published on Aug. 25, Juche 102 (2013) deals with the Songun revolutionary exploits of leader Kim Jong Il and the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and indicates tasks for successfully accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- A Russian committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Moscow on Oct. 27.
					 V. A. Petrov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize such political and cultural events as a remembrance meeting, book and photo exhibition and round-table talks to commemorate the third anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Guinea
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Guinea
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- A seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" took place in Conakry, Guinea on Oct. 23.
					 Present there were personages of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry and Kankan University of Guinea and followers of the Juche idea.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, in his report outlined the main content of the work, saying that it proves the validity of socialism.
					
					 Abdoulaye Diallo, chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, stressed that Kim Jong Il dealt a telling blow at the imperialists and reactionaries while instilling the confidence in victory into progressive humankind aspiring after socialism.
					
					 Camano Vitor, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, said that the validity and vitality of the work have been fully displayed for the twenty years after its publication and that the DPRK won a brilliant victory in defending socialism and ushered in a heyday of building a thriving nation.
					
					 Mohamed Diouhe Fofana, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea at Kankan University, said that Kim Jong Il injected a fresh vitality in the global socialist movement by publishing the work and that socialism is sure to emerge victorious for its scientific accuracy and truth.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Career Lauded by Nigerian Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Career Lauded by Nigerian Body
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted articles on its website to commemorate the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The website said in an article titled "Legacy left by leader Kim Jong Il" on Oct. 14:
					
					 Kim Jong Il left the great exploits guaranteeing the eternal foundation and rosy future of socialist Korea as his legacy.
					
					 He developed the Workers' Party of Korea into an ever-victorious guiding force, the DPRK into an indestructible socialist state and the Korean People's Army into an invincible army.
					
					 Under his guidance the DPRK proudly emerged a powerful nuclear weapons state.
					
					 He also brought about a radical turn in building a thriving socialist nation and his guidance made the DPRK a satellite manufacturing and launching state.
					
					 The immortal exploits performed by him all his life will remain long as the most precious legacy guaranteeing the victory of the socialist cause in the DPRK and the accomplishment of the human cause of independence.
					
					 The website in another article titled "The Juche idea and Kim Jong Il" on Oct. 15 said that it is quite natural to call the revolutionary ideas of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 In an article titled "White snow and Kim Jong Il" on Oct. 21, it said his revolutionary life was as pure as white snow, stressing that his noble life will remain forever in the hearts of the Korean people and the world progressives.

articles.title: Socialism Is Sure to Triumph: German Organization
articles.content:
Socialism Is Sure to Triumph: German Organization
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) --  The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany posted on its website an article illustrated with a photo of leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the publication of his work "Socialism Is a Science". 
					 The article said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il published famous work "Socialism Is a Science" indicating the way for a new surge and sure victory in the socialist movement on November 1, 1994.
					
					 In the work he clarified that the collapse of socialism in various countries does not mean the failure of socialism as a science but the bankruptcy of opportunism which made socialism degenerated. 
					
					 He proved inevitability and invincibility of socialism and indicated the way for successfully building socialism.
					
					 He declared that man-centred socialism, socialism centred on the popular masses, is sure to triumph for its scientific accuracy and truth. 
					
					 The Korean people are dynamically advancing to attain the grandiose goal of building a thriving socialist nation, decisively smashing the persistent moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle socialism with sure faith in socialism and confidence of sure victory. 
					
					 Socialism is a science and it is sure to win.

articles.title: DPRK Guarantees Human Rights at Highest Level: Russian Paper
articles.content:
DPRK Guarantees Human Rights at Highest Level: Russian Paper
						
 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The 39th issue of the Russian newspaper Veteran carried an article titled "Everything for welfare of people". 
					 All citizens above 17 in the DPRK irrespective of sex, nationality, occupation, property status, education, party affiliation, political view and religious belief have rights to vote and to be elected, the article said, and went on:
					
					 In the DPRK people freely take part in political activities and the rights to speech, assembly and religious belief are guaranteed by law. 
					
					 In the DPRK free from exploitation and oppression and without the gap between the rich and the poor everybody is provided with necessary conditions for food, clothing and housing by the state and enjoys an equal and stable life. 
					
					 It is none other than the DPRK where all members of the society are given all rights including rights to work and rest and free education and healthcare. 
					
					 The state regards housing construction as an important work for providing the people with conditions for cultural and stable life and pays deep attention to it. 
					
					 Ordinary teachers, researchers and working people are provided with flats free in the modern apartment houses for educators of Kim Il Sung University, those in Changjon Street, Unha Scientists Street, etc. built in Pyongyang in recent years. 
					
					 The state looks after the living of the old people without supporters, children and disabled persons in a responsible manner. 
					
					 Women have equal rights with men and enjoy special benefits from the state and society. 
					
					 Human rights of the people in the DPRK are fully guaranteed because the country is guided by the Juche idea. 
					
					 It is quite natural that human rights are guaranteed at the highest level in the country guided by this idea.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre Kim Yong Nam y Yoweri Kaguta Museveni
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre Kim Yong Nam y Yoweri Kaguta Museveni
						
Kampala, 30 de octubre (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 30 en el Palacio Presidencial de Uganda las conversaciones entre el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, de visita oficial y de amistad en Uganda, y el presidente de este pais Yoweri Kaguta Museveni. 
					Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes en esta ocasion el ministro de Salud Publica, Kang Ha Guk, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kung Sok Ung, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, So Kil Bok, el embajador coreano en Uganda Myong Kyong Chol y otros acompanantes por la parte coreana, y por la ugandesa, el canciller interino Asuman Kiyingi y otros funcionarios del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam departe con presidente de Asamblea Nacional de Uganda
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam departe con presidente de Asamblea Nacional de Uganda
						
Kampala, 30 de octubre (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, de visita oficial y de amistad en la Republica de Uganda, departio el dia 30 en la sede de la Asamblea Nacional del pais africano con el presidente de esta entidad.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el ministro de Salud Publica, Kang Ha Guk, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kung Sok Ung, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, So Kil Bok, el embajador coreano en Uganda, Myong Kyong Chol, y otros acompanantes por la parte coreana, y por la ugandesa, el canciller interino Asuman Kiyingi, el presidente del comite de relaciones exteriores de la Asamblea Nacional y otros funcionarios interesados.

articles.title: Presidente ugandes ofrece banquete en honor de Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Presidente ugandes ofrece banquete en honor de Kim Yong Nam 
						
Kampala, 30 de octubre (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente de la Republica de Uganda, Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, ofrecio el dia 30 en el Palacio Presidencial un banquete en honor del presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam. 
					Fueron invitados el ministro de Salud Publica Kang Ha Guk, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero So Kil Bok, el embajador en Uganda Myong Kyong Chol y otros acompanantes. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente Edward Kiwanuka Ssekandi, el subsecretario general del Movimiento Nacional de la Resistencia de Uganda, Dorothy Hyuha, el ministro de Justicia Kahinda Otafire, el vicepresidente del Asamblea Nacional Jacob Oranya, el canciller interino Asuman Kiyingi, y otros funcionarios y los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises en Uganda. 
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, Yoweri Kaguta Museveni dijo que la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea brindo la ayuda material y espiritual a Uganda y otros paises africanos cuando libraban la lucha por la construccion de nueva sociedad despues de la independencia. 
					
					Expuso la decision de hacer todos los esfuerzos por consolidar la cooperacion con la RPDC en la palestra internacional incluso el Movimiento de los Paises No Alineados. 
					
					Kim Yong Nam dijo en su discurso que la firme base de las relaciones entre los dos paises preparadas por los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il junto con Su Excelencia Yoweri Kaguta Museveni se fortalecen mas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que su presente visita contribuira a consolidar mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita reeleccion de Dilma Rousseff
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita reeleccion de Dilma Rousseff
						
Pyongyang, 31 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 28 un mensaje de felicitacion a la reelecta presidenta brasilena Dilma Rousseff. 
					Convencido de que seguiran ampliandose y fortaleciendose las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises en desarrollo favorable, el remitente desea de todo corazon a la destinataria mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa pesar por deceso del presidente zambiano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa pesar por deceso del presidente zambiano 
						
Pyongyang, 31 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 30 un mensaje de condolencias al vicepresidente de la Republica de Zambia, Guy Scott, con motivo del fallecimiento por enfermedad del presidente zambiano, Michael Chilufya Sata. 
					El remitente expreso profundas condolencias al destinatario y por su conducto, al gobierno y pueblo de Zambia y los familiares del difunto. 
					
					Deseo que el gobierno y pueblo amistosos de Zambia se repongan de la tristeza de hoy y logren el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: CC de PTC felicita 60o aniversario de fundacion del PFLNA
articles.content:
CC de PTC felicita 60o aniversario de fundacion del PFLNA
						
　Pyongyang, 31 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea envio el dia 31 un mensaje de felicitacion al Comite Central del Partido Frente de Liberacion Nacional de Argelia (PFLNA) con motivo del 60o aniversario de esta organizacion politica.
					　La misiva expresa la conviccion de que las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre los dos partidos se amplien y se desarrollen mas en el futuro y desea de todo corazon mayores exitos en las actividades del PFLNA por su fortalecimiento y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: CNCDP denuncia confabulacion militar EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CNCDP denuncia confabulacion militar EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 31 de octubre (ACNC) -- En su declaracion fechada 30, el portavoz del Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz (CNCDP) denuncio a los titeres surcoreanos que acordaron con Estados Unidos aplazar el traspaso del mando de operaciones en el tiempo de guerra. 
					La nota lo califica de tremendo crimen antinacional de que no serian capaces ni los "5 traidores de Ulsa" que vendieron el pais a las fuerzas extranjeras, y de acto peligroso que lleva al borde de guerra nuclear la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y la region. 
					
					En el mundo existen muchos paises y naciones, pero, no hay traidores tan imbeciles como los titeres surcoreanos que pagan enormes fondos a las fuerzas extranjeras para no rescatar la soberania militar arrebatada por ellas, critica el documento y prosigue: 
					
					Es muy ridiculo que esos esclavos coloniales de EE.UU., que estan privados de la autoridad militar, lo fundamental de la soberania estatal,  actuaran como "pais avanzado" hablando del "estatus del Estado". 
					
					Sobrepasa el limite la confabulacion militar de caracter agresivo entre EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos, debido a lo cual se aumenta mas el peligro de guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana y se ven amenazadas la paz y la seguridad de Asia y el resto del mundo. 
					
					La realidad de hoy evidencia cuan justa es nuestra opcion de consolidar por todos los medios el disuasivo nuclear de autodefensa segun la linea de desarrollo paralelo de la construccion economica y aumento de fuerzas armadas. 
					
					Nuestro ejercito y pueblo no perdonaran jamas las maniobras de EE.UU. y los belicistas surcoreanos tendentes a provocar la guerra nuclear y las frustraran con el poderio del Songun. 
					
					La confabulacion militar entre EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea no les dara otro resultado que el fin vergonzoso de ellos mismos.
